questions.question: Which of the following is a tautology?
How many edges are there in a complete graph with 5 vertices?
Which of the following relations is reflexive but not symmetric?
What is the number of vertices in a full binary tree with 20 leaves?
Which of the following is NOT a valid property of equivalence relations?
The number of distinct Boolean functions of n variables is:
Which of the following graphs is Eulerian but not Hamiltonian?
options: Graph with two vertices and one edge

questions.question: The chromatic number of a complete bipartite graph K3,3 is:
Which of the following is the contrapositive of 'If it rains, then I stay home'?
options: If I stay home, then it rains
If I don't stay home, then it doesn't rain
If it doesn't rain, then I don't stay home
I stay home only if it rains
questions.answer: If I don't stay home, then it doesn't rain

questions.question: The number of edges in a tree with 10 vertices is:
Which of the following is the correct negation of ∀x∃y(P(x,y))?
The number of distinct permutations of the letters in 'MISSISSIPPI' is:
Which of the following is NOT a valid logical equivalence?
The number of edges in a complete graph with n vertices is:
Which of the following is true about a bipartite graph?
options: It can be colored with 2 colors
It has an odd number of vertices
questions.answer: It can be colored with 2 colors

questions.question: The solution to the recurrence relation T(n) = T(n-1) + 1 with T(0) = 1 is:
Which of the following is the generating function for the sequence 1,1,1,1,...?
The number of ways to arrange 5 distinct books on a shelf is:
Which of the following is NOT a group property?
The number of subsets of a set with n elements is:
Which of the following graphs is planar?
The number of binary relations from a set A with m elements to a set B with n elements is:
Which of the following is the correct representation of 'All dogs are mammals' in predicate logic?
The number of distinct Hamiltonian cycles in a complete graph with n vertices is:
Which of the following is true about a connected planar graph with e edges, v vertices and f faces?
The number of ways to choose a committee of 3 people from 10 is:
Which of the following is the dual of the Boolean expression x + y·z?
The number of one-to-one functions from a set with m elements to a set with n elements (m ≤ n) is:
Which of the following is NOT a valid inference rule?
The number of edges in a cube (as a graph) is:
Which of the following is the correct translation of 'No cats are dogs' in predicate logic?
The solution to the recurrence relation T(n) = 2T(n/2) + n with T(1) = 1 is:
Which of the following is a valid walk in a graph but not necessarily a path?
options: A sequence of adjacent vertices with no repetitions
A sequence of adjacent edges with no repetitions
A sequence of adjacent vertices that may repeat vertices
A sequence that visits all vertices exactly once
questions.answer: A sequence of adjacent vertices that may repeat vertices

questions.question: The number of ways to distribute 10 identical balls into 4 distinct boxes is:
Which of the following is true about a partial order relation?
The number of leaves in a complete binary tree of height h is:
Which of the following is the correct simplification of the Boolean expression x + x'y?
The number of binary strings of length n with exactly k 1's is:
Which of the following is true about a spanning tree of a connected graph G?
options: It must contain all edges of G
It must contain all vertices of G
It must be a complete graph
questions.answer: It must contain all vertices of G

questions.question: The number of derangements (permutations where no element appears in its original position) of 4 elements is:
Which of the following is the correct representation of 'Some birds cannot fly' in predicate logic?
The number of distinct Boolean functions with 3 variables is:
Which of the following is true about a simple graph with n vertices where each vertex has degree at least n/2?
The number of ways to climb a staircase with 10 steps, taking 1 or 2 steps at a time, is equal to:
Which of the following is the correct negation of 'If x is even, then x^2 is even'?
options: If x is not even, then x^2 is not even
x is even and x^2 is not even
If x^2 is even, then x is even
x is not even or x^2 is even
questions.answer: x is even and x^2 is not even

questions.question: The number of distinct spanning trees of a complete graph with 4 vertices is:
Which of the following is NOT a valid rule of inference in propositional logic?
The number of ways to partition a set of 4 distinct elements into two subsets of 2 elements each is:
Which of the following is true about a graph where every vertex has even degree?
The number of edges in a complete bipartite graph K3,4 is:
Which of the following is the correct simplification of (A ∪ B) ∩ (A ∪ B')?
The number of ways to arrange 5 people in a circular table is:
Which of the following is the correct representation of 'There is exactly one even prime number' in predicate logic?
The number of distinct relations on a set with 3 elements is:
Which of the following is the chromatic polynomial for a tree with n vertices?
